roleset.name: (cause to) become afraid, afraid
roleset.note: SCARE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'scare' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Adjectival usage 'scary' based on BOLT-1; adjectival 'scared' based on BOLT-6. Member of Vncls amuse-31.1. (from scare.01-v)
SCARE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on scare-v.01. Corresponds to Vncls amuse-31.1. (from scare.01-n)
SCARED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from scared.01-j)

roles.note: Arg0-agent is extremely unlikely to occur in nominalizations, but in the event it actually does, call it arg0 and send it in. Arg3-intensifier not needed in the nominalization. (from scare.01-n)

example.name: scare-v: transitive
example.text: Such disclosures of big holdings often are used by raiders-1 [*trace*-1]-2 to try *trace*-2 to scare a company's managers.

example.name: scare-v: with instrument
example.text: Mary scared John with her blood-red fingernails.

example.name: scare-v: with intensifier
example.text: It won't take [much more]-1 *trace*-1 to ``scare the hell out of retail investors,'' he says.

example.name: scare-v: another intensifier example
example.text: ``Small investors are absolutely dismayed that Wall Street is stacking the deck against them, and these wide swings are scaring them to death.

example.name: scare-n: just arg2
example.text: The scare over Alar , a growth regulator that makes apples redder and crunchier but may be carcinogenic , made consumers shy away from the Delicious , though they were less affected than the McIntosh .
example.arg: over Alar, a growth regulator that makes apples redder and crunchier but may be carcinogenic

example.name: scare-n: both args
example.text: Bud Noetzel is recovering from his scare of fluid in his lungs.

example.name: scare-n: another with both args
example.text: Between her pregnancy scare and alleged breakup with Miles Austin, Kim could have a difficult transition when she returns home this week.

roleset.name: scare and make go away, or into motion
roleset.note: SCARE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls amuse-31.1. (from scare.02-v)

example.name: scare-v: scare off
example.text: [Their opposition]-1 helped *trace*-1 scare off some Japanese banks .

example.name: scare-v: scare away
example.text: Mr. DaPuzzo also complained that the sharp swings in stock prices lately is scaring away retail and foreign investors.
example.arg: the sharp swings in stock prices

example.name: scare-v: with resulting action
example.text: Mr. Brady also agreed with senators' concerns about recent stock-market volatility, and said he realizes that the gyrations are scaring investors from investing in stocks.

roleset.name: frightening
roleset.note: SCARY-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from scary.01-j)

example.name: scary-j
example.text: If so , I think it 's scary .

example.name: scary-j; args 0, 2
example.text: That book is scary with its subtle details and very beautifully written.
